newsitem.title: USA: Adobe Q3 shr falls on seasonality, delays. [CORRECTED 22:03 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Adobe Q3 shr falls on seasonality, delays. [CORRECTED 22:03 GMT]

text.p: Adobe Systems Inc, a maker of printing and graphics software, said on Wednesday third quarter earnings fell from year ago levels due to fewer sales of Macintosh products, new product delays and seasonality.

The company earned $0.40 a share in the quarter after a gain of $0.05 a share for gains on investments. That figure is right on target with analysts's forecasts of $0.35 a share before the gain, but below year ago earnings of $0.44 a share.
In after hours trading immediately after the earnings announcement, Adobe shares rose 2-1/2 to 37-1/2 from Wednesday's closing price of 35.
Macintosh computers, made by Apple Computer Inc, appeal strongly to graphics and design professionals who are also more likely to purchase Adobe products.
Sales of products based on Microsoft Corp's Windows operating system now make up nearly 44 percent of total sales.

Sales of application products fell to $130 million from $138 million last year, while revenues from licensing its software rose to $50.4 million from $45 million one year ago, reflecting an increase in the popularity of color printers, among other reasons, Adobe said in a statement.
